website_summaries.verdict: The best budget handheld pool vacuum that offers a self-contained unit without any hookups.
pros: Small vacuum unit uses siphon action to clean your pool
Has a significant amount of suction
Telescopic handle extends out to 7 feet for extra reach inside deeper pools
cons: Will not reliably work in shallow kiddie pools due to minimum depth requirements

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant.  The best.
customer_reviews.text: I have two hot tubs and have been battling dirt, sand, leaves, etc... for years. I have gone through 5 other spa vacuums and none of them worked. The Paradise works like a champ. No batteries, easy to clean, and effective. There is zero set up and it takes 30 seconds to read the instructions and use it. It picked up leaves and sand like a champ. I am buying a second one for my beach house. I do not know how this product could be any better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Cheapo Hinge
customer_reviews.text: So we had this for exactly 6 months before the little flap the prevents dirty water from just running back in the tub corroded and snapped of. The little cheap plastic hinge gets weak, and breaks, making this $50 investments a waste of time. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: James Danielson

customer_reviews.title: Who knew how fun cleaning the swim spa could be!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg I can't believe I'm disappointed that all the sand is off the floor of my swim spa. This thing is so fun!! I got on my mask and snorkel and it was like shooting the dirt. You just release your thumb a little bit to suck up all the crap in the corners!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: Nearly useless!
customer_reviews.text: I was very hopeful. You're supposed to hold your thumb over the air release, put the vacuum in the spa, then remove your thumb, which makes the water and debris flow into the vacuum. Unfortunately, it only vacuums for about 3 second before you have to lift it up, wait for the water to drain, then do it again....and while the water is draining, the debris left in the spa gets scattered, making it even harder to get. returning.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry G

customer_reviews.title: kinda works, sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Good concept, poor function. The small quarter sized flapper door is suppose to close preventing backwash, my door repeatedly doea not even after washing out grime. Also, this relies on hydrostatic pressure, so its no good for steps or surfaces less than a couple feet. Additionally, because there is no hand pump, this takes forever to cylce if you are doing more than one small spot. It took 10 minutes to do what 1 minute of a hand pump would do. I am going back to one with the hand suction pump.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Works but a little picky
customer_reviews.text: Works good once you figure it out, otherwise the flap opens and all the dirt comes out. It’s a learned process but it’s the best one we have found that works
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: It does work but its a LOT of work.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for our hot tub. Though in the end it will get most particles from the hot tub, the amount it will suck up with each submersion is frustrating. It takes in a LOT of water and very few particles and you have to be RIGHT on top of the particle for it to grab them. It has to be fully submerged to work at all so you have to repeatedly pause to take it out, let all the water drain and then re-submerge for the next attempt. Its a LOT of work.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t filter sand
customer_reviews.text: This works fine for picking up larger particles but doesn’t pick up any sand. It goes up the suction and then must pass through their filters. I wish they used a smaller mesh size because that’s why I bought this. I’ve tried it a dozen times now and the sand remains. Now I need to find something that actually works. Any recommendations? Sucks because it cost a lot for it not to do what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Germain

customer_reviews.title: Wow. This is a breathtakingly terrible product.
customer_reviews.text: This product works by using the 2-3 second vacuum that occurs when you submerge an object in water. You have 2-3 seconds of suction then have to pull it out and start over. This is absolutely impossible to use to vacuum a spa out. It you’re only interested in suctioning out a small leaf and willing to take a couple of stabs at it, then this is the vacuum for you. I got a 1/2” diameter leaf after 4 tries. Just one leaf. Because there wasn’t even enough suction time to get the pine needle next to it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, yet light vacuum!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this vacuum. It is simple, yet does the job. I only wished the suction power lasted longer than a few seconds each time. It does a great great job in suctioning up the debris in our hot tub. It took me a few tries to really get the hang of how to work the suction, but once you figure out that all you need to do is put your thumb over the opening at the top of the handle before you place the vacuum in the hot tub it is simple. You then let go and it has a pretty powerful suction. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works really well for my spa attached to my pool and the corners of the steps around the pool where dirt and stuff tend to rest and the vacuum cant reach. The main water tube isn't huge so you probably got a good 2-3 seconds tops of suction. It's done on purpose because if the part you are vacuuming is too shallow, and the water tank is above water...well, physics and it won't fill causing no suction. It holds in sand and find dirt and picks up some heavy material too. Perfect for grabbing a handful of dirt befrore jumping in the spa.
customer_reviews.author: prin05

customer_reviews.title: Worth!
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough. Yes it takes time but I like that there are no electrical components. It doesn't seem to do well with powdery dirt that accumulates around the bottom, but it definitely keeps my spa looking clean until it's time to dump and refill the water in my hot tub. I use it for about ten minutes the day after a few people have been in the spa with dirty feet from the concrete and that's been good enough for us. Glad I didn't pay more for the other devices that I'm sure do the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: E_Royall

customer_reviews.title: A good thing. A brilliant idea
customer_reviews.text: A good thing. A brilliant idea. I am someone who supports anything that uses zero energy. However, you must expect that cleaning your spa will take a long time with this device. Each "reset", which involves taking the device our of the spa and waiting for it to drain, gives you about 10 seconds of vacuuming. So, cleaning a small 7' spa will therefore take about 10-15 repeats of the above as 10 seconds of vacuuming cleans about 2-3 feet of spa surface. So if the spa is in a dirty area or isn't covered, cleaning could be very tedious and time consuming.
customer_reviews.author: Green Guy 33068

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but poor design
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have mentioned there is a flap that does not always close. This leaves a HUGE mess in the tub, imagine all of the hair and debris that you just vacuumed up dispersing through the water. Honestly, this product makes a bigger mess than it does clean. Now instead of sucking up debris on the bottom of your tub you are fishing it out with a net or wait for it to settle and try again.. Seems like a simple spring would force the flap to close each time.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great concept....Fantastic Engineering...but..
customer_reviews.text: Hated to return this because the designers used ingenious reverse toilet fluid dynamics to create suction...however the area of suction is so concentrated it is not applicable to a small 14 ft pool...it would take you forever...if you use it for a baby pool or spa, it would be excellent. My particular unit lost an internal screw somehow and the flap did not function properly. I still recommend ,solidly built, quality material and will certainly try other offerings from the company!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good product - Lousy Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this vacuum almost everyday for the past two months or so. I hose down the filters after every use. I was amazed by it for a long time, but it recently began to lose its suction power. I know that I need to buy some new filters (not available on Amazon) and have contacted the manufacturer about the suction problem before I have pulled the trigger on buying them - in case they suggest additional part replacement. It’s been almost 2 weeks without any response.
customer_reviews.author: mamaqueue

customer_reviews.title: Horrible spa vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Horrible vacuums for a swim spa. I have a 17 foot by 6 foot spa and it takes about 20 minutes to vacuum it with this. Then it seems like most of the debris falls back in because the filter becomes loose in the canister. So i open it up, reposition the filter, then the same happens again.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Poor product.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. No instructions on how to assemble. No instructions on how to clean it. It worked great for the first 15 minutes, except it was INCREDIBLY slow draining (which you have to do every 5 seconds. Literally. Submerge it, open valve for 5 seconds, drain l remove from water and drain for 30 seconds). But now it seems to be broken. Everything's still in place but it just suctions the bad stuff in, and when I release it, it just let's it all back out again. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: 80sGuyJim

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after purchase the little cap on the inside of the tube had issues closing and finally after about five months, it broke off completely. Without this functioning cap, it sends a good portion of the debris back in the water as you raise up the vacuum. Also, asthetically, the plastic yellows under the Texas sun. It is also a little slower to use than I had hoped. You're allowed about three seconds of suction before you have to lift it up, let it drain and repeat the process. I think if they just spent a little more on the manufacturing of a more durable inner piece of plastic it would be alright.
customer_reviews.author: DFW mom

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Have a very small (7x9) exercise pool and thought this would suffice for cleaning. Suction works well, but is finger activated and fills after only about 5 seconds, picking up little debris, before having to pull out of the water and repeat. A bit of debris falls back into the pool as the water is released for the repeat process. All of this makes the cleaning process very time consuming. Am able to accomplish more in less time using the hose system in the cleaning kit purchased separately that includes a brush, net, and mechanism similar to this that doesn't require emptying chamber of water every few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: farmdog13

customer_reviews.title: It works great on small pools!!
customer_reviews.text: BEST NEW POOL TOY. EVER. I’ve been cleaning my pool with inadequate vacuum tools but THIS ONE works. It’s so perfect for a small pool. It’s cheap, and it works! Very satisfying to suck up the small junk my filter misses. No batteries, no garden hose needed. Just gravity and water pressure. It comes apart easily so you can rinse out the filter. Just swirl the pool water in one direction to create a vortex, let it settle, and all your little pieces of junk will be in the center. One or two quick passes with this thing will get it all.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up. Does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: These is amazing for the hot tub. Once you learn how to use this you will wonder how you did without it. It literally only vacuums during the fill up time which is Seconds actually. But you keep thumb over hole until you are at the trash in bottom. Grass clipping or a leaf..hair on intake filters. No hose hook up. I recommend. Give yourself a few minutes to get the hang of it. It hold lots of debri in the collection filter so no need to dump collection filter until finished. I never liked the hose driven vacuums. I set out looking for these and found a good one. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Dottie

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so fun and easy to use it's just great! It's works better than I could have imagined. You just poke it in the water, it pulls out the debris, you lift it out and allow it to drain back in the water. Do it again. That easy. You simply put your finger over the tiny hole at the handle's top to allow water in and out. Do this very quickly and you can clean several small areas all with one cycle. It's perfect! No batteries required and the large canister holds lots of debris which is easy to empty after many many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Zog

customer_reviews.title: Leaks debris periodically
customer_reviews.text: At first this seemed to work well, though the suction power only lasts a couple of seconds. But after several uses, I noticed that periodically it would dump all of the collected debris in the water and I had to start over. Quite annoying! Ultimately I used it by dumping it out on the side of the pool, which causes you to lose a little bit of water each time you use it. It still leaks some of the debris before I have a chance to get it to the side. So it's kind of a two steps forward, one step backward situation.
customer_reviews.author: Ward Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Gravity only, works great when the hot tub is full!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has no moving parts and works by gravity alone. In other words, there is no manual pump action like with some similar looking spa vacuums. In my opinion that makes it easier to use for some people, and the absence of mechanical parts means there is less that can go wrong with it. The only drawback would be if you wanted to use it to clean the spa while filling or while partially empty, in which case it won't work so well, because there won't be enough water pressure to create a good vacuum effect. As long as it is used with a full tub, it works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Ian S

customer_reviews.title: Best one I found
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for your spa/jacuzzi/hot tub, whatever you want to call it, or even your pool. Great suction power and keeps the pebbles/stones/debris/sand in the unit until you clean the unit. Unscrew cap, disassemble two filter pieces and hose down with water to clean. Simple very easy. Made of sturdy grade plastic, I’ve dropped it several times and it still works perfectly, I don’t imagine I’ll get away with that forever though as it is plastic. But good solid sturdy reliable non powered vacuum for your pool or spa.
customer_reviews.author: Amazondragonfly

customer_reviews.title: design flaw allows sucked up leaves to spill out.
customer_reviews.text: this would be great but unfortunately, it is designed in such a way that after you have sucked up your debris and allow the water to come out, often the debris escapes with it. my pro spa guy uses one to clean his client's spas, but says he deals with the problem by empty the water OUTSIDE the spa each time he sucks up debris. obviously, this wastes water if used a lot and means you have to keep filling the spa
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent spa vacuum
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and works on air displacement suction. For picking up small amounts of dirt, and whatever junk at the bottom of the spa, it is very simple and reasonably fast. You hold your finger over the hole at the end of the pole, submerge the end until its very close to the dirt & let the air hole open. As the water pushes into the container, it creates a vacuum pulling in the dirt. Each "cycle" last for 3-4 seconds. If there is a lot of crud at the bottom of the spa, it will take a little bit of time to clean it out, but for the occasional spot clean, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: David Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: very convenient to remove sediment from hot tub
customer_reviews.text: we have a small hot tub (~6ftx6ft) and neeeded a way to suck up the tiny rocks and sand that accumulate on the bottom. this works great - takes a minute or two to suck everything up. a few tips: you have to be standing up to use it, or else the handle is too long (so you can't use it while sitting in the hot tub). the suction is literally only for a few seconds, so this would definitely not be practical for large areas or large amounts of sediment. it's a great option for such a small job though.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Stern

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says for sure - not for huge jobs  but it does work
customer_reviews.text: We have a 4 person hot tub - as others have said it does work - no electricity needed, just your finger covering the hole- so as far a price is concerned meh - pricey, but hey I wasn't smart enough to come up with a tube that just uses your finger to get sand and small little bits out of the bottom of the tub so who am I to complain. It does what it says it will do if you have a bigger tub it may take you a while. It took me about 15 minutes - probably won't have to use it again until next year
customer_reviews.author: schoolee

customer_reviews.title: This product sucks!
customer_reviews.text: This product has excellent suction and easily picks up sand, dirt, and leaves from the bottom of the pool; however, the flap that allows debris into the compartment does not stay closed. That means ALL of the crap that it picked up falls right back into the pool when you lift the device out of the water. You are required to lift the device out of the water to discard the debris, so essentially, it does not remove anything from the pool. If the manufacturer found a way to install a one-way valve this would be an awesome tool!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much I bought it again
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke after a couple years, so I researched the options and bought the same one again. It is fast, easy, and reliable (but don't drop it on asphalt). The deeper the water, the more powerful the suction. Works great in my spa and even on the spa seats (which are shallower). But it likely won't have much suction in water less than 1-2 feet deep.
customer_reviews.author: Change the World!

customer_reviews.title: is sturdy and suited to home use
customer_reviews.text: We didn't want to buy an expensive vacuum for our hot tub which has only occasional sediment/sand on a seat. After comparing the many mechanical vacuums, we settled on this one because of the long handle. This is really handy since the depth, even on the seats is mostly longer than my arm. The vacuum, while plastic, is sturdy and suited to home use. The pressure suction is excellent and it's also very easy to use - all you do is hold a finger/thumb over the hole on the top end and plunge the vacuum to where dirt is, and it sucks it up. The filter captures the dirt in the vacuum while releasing the water. Simple & effective!
customer_reviews.author: toni tempel navarro

customer_reviews.title: Why does this get good reviews?
customer_reviews.text: I spent almost an hour trying to clean my tiny hot tub. The vacuum sort of works, but you have no control over what water goes in and what goes out. You'd have to spend hours and hours trying to suck up random water to get the hairs, dirt, and other particles out of the water. It is easy to use, but the effectiveness I would give zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Do not work on desert sand
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine in the beginning, but after 1 month it started slowing down and now it is useless; unfortunately I had to go out of town and when I came back I could not return it any longer. I tried washing the filters every time I used it, but it still takes over 5 minutes to return the water from the tank and it comes back full of sand. I've been returning the water to a bucket now with a pantyhose as an extra filter and sure enough, the pantyhose gets full of sand. It might be o.k. for leaves, but does nothing for the fine Arizona desert sand.
customer_reviews.author: Elia

customer_reviews.title: This product is perfect for our swim spa
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. After reading other reviews, I knew just what to expect and it didn't disappoint. We have a swim spa (15'x7.5'x5') so I knew just the type of cleaner I needed to be able to get sand, etc off the floor of 'pool'.... this works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: ShellyM

customer_reviews.title: Will buy the next version, this one is wimpy
customer_reviews.text: Returning it: Innovative design, looking forward to the new and improved version. The canister and slit opening need to be twice as big. It fills up too quickly to be useful. It works! But is not practical with current design. :( It's probably a relaxing to spend all afternoon using this tool to clean the bottom of the kid pool/spa. But what's more relaxing is being done cleaning the kid pool/spa!
customer_reviews.author: Brighton

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a vacuum for your small pool or hot tub this is what you need. I had some silt in my small pool and I didn't want to spend a whole lot of money. This is hand held and takes a little time if you have a lot to clean out but this works GREAT. I love the way this one works. Just put your finger over the hole, when you aim for the trash take your finger off the hole and it sucks it right up! How easy is that. So glad that I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila P. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Its fine for spot cleanup
customer_reviews.text: for some reason our pool pumo hates when we use a vacuum. It messes up the suction and then the sand filter gets messed up. So we wanted to try this. It works on our vinyl lined above ground pool. The ends are sharp though which really is my only complaint. You need to be careful. I will be getting baby bumper covers and covering up the hard plastic so we don't scrape the bottom of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but pulled the trigger on this neat little tool. It works just fine in my Spa to remove the gravel that invariably ends up on the bottom or the seats. Deceptively simple to use, I counted about four seconds of active suction and that's plenty to clean a seat. Very happy with it over all. I was disappointed that I immediately had to hot glue the wide tip adapter onto the inlet tube. It fit so loosely that I was afraid it would simply fall off when trying to use it. A small bit of glue and voila! I would certainly buy it again and recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney M. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good for touch-ups
customer_reviews.text: This would be great for touch-ups in between vacuuming. We have an above ground pool (not very big) and I can't even fathom how many hours it would take using this item alone. However it does work. It's like a hand hand held vacuum compared to a regular home vacuum. Very handy for small areas!
customer_reviews.author: Penguins

customer_reviews.title: Works great-for 3-5 seconds
customer_reviews.text: It does work, and it works very well. However, it only works for about 3-5 seconds before its full and you have to dump it outside of the pool to keep from reclouding the water. For even a smaller pool like mine this takes forever. Not a good option for a pool unless its a kiddie pool. It would be great for a spa, but it's marketed for pools too and thats just unfeasible. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this vacuum. I have an above ground 16x48 pool. All I needed was a vacuum that could pick up the debris that gets settled on the bottom. The debris that the skimmer can't get well. And this did the trick! Easy to use and clean. I love it! Now, it is time consuming, but not to bad. In the end it's worth it. My 15 year old son had a blast cleaning the pool. It is a bit pricey. But the convenience is worth it to me. :)
customer_reviews.author: Tarrah

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Awful! I bought this to clean out my kids small 3 ft deep pool. I used it one time and put it right back in the box to return. There was suction for maybe 2 minutes or however long it took to fill up the little tank at the bottom of the vaccuum. It was not worth 60 dollars. Plus, the stuff it did suck up would come right back out when the tank emptied. Not happy with the vaccuum at all.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne Knight

customer_reviews.title: Guess I paid for what I got
customer_reviews.text: I guess the reviews sold me this for my hot tub, but didn't work to my satisfaction. You have to be fast. It will take the dirt out, but the tube fills with water in like seconds. Directions very vague, but it was cheap so what should I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good concept but not well made
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I thought this product would be a good fit for my hot tub cleaning needs. I gave it 2 stars because it did collect some debris but on the first use, the flap that is supposed to shut once the chamber stop sucking in water kept sticking in the open position allowing debris to drain back into the hot tub. I was able to clean my hot tub using a combination of this device and my net to collect the debris that escaped. Not what I envisioned when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Rainwater

customer_reviews.title: have to clean alot
customer_reviews.text: This is good for small pools, cleans maybe a 6x6inch area per pass. In my pools, the silt clogs the screen so fast I was constantly rinsing it off. So I removed the screens and hold my finger over the hole when lifting out and drain it outside the pool! Problem solved. I love that it's grab and go-no hook-up to anything although for what it is the price seemed a little high, thus the 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Jan Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and then some
customer_reviews.text: A bit unorthodox at first, but it is the only (extremely affordable) vacuum I’ve found that can effectively remove fine dirt from the bottom of our pool (an Intex 48”x15’). The handle extends long enough to where I’m not having to even get in the pool to clean it. In short, if you’re having issues getting a tool that can remove fine dust/dirt/debris from the bottom of your pool or spa - this wreaking havoc on your water chemistry and/or causing algae issues - look no further. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: ngray20

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for a hot tub
customer_reviews.text: This thing really works! I have tiny gravel and grit that finds its way into the bottom of my hot tub. This is easily put together and you just stick it in the water while holding your finger over the end and then it suctions the stones out. They collect in a chamber as you let the water back out. The only cons are that it only has a few seconds of vacuum before you have to start over. It really wouldn't work well in a pool due to short time you have. To empty the gravel from the collection chamber you have to twist the end off which sometimes sticks a little.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelRTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Useless. Would take an eternity to clean a 7' x 11' pool.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly Useless. Would take an eternity to clean a 7' x 11' pool. Maybe if you just need to pick up one sunken leaf in your spa this might be ok. Product itself is faulty and allows picked up debris to go right back into the water via a little valve that does not always stay closed upon removal. You have about 3 seconds (that's actually generous) of suction before the chamber fills with water. You can maybe clean a 3" x 5" section at a time. Waste of money on a non-recyclable item. Bound for the landfill. :(
customer_reviews.author: Hz_Gypzy

customer_reviews.title: Works great for keeping my hot tub clean.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the reviews I read were positive, so I decided to buy this for my hot tub. It works really well for picking up bits of of dust and dirt that fall to the bottom of the spa. I think this is a no-brainer buy for anybody with a spa or small pool they want to keep clean. The few negative reviews from whiny people on here I think is because they bought this for a large pool, where this vacuum can't get to the bottom. It's called a SPA vacuum, not a POOL vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Benecia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is perfect for a hot tub. Very little suction power but perfect for those few pebbles floating at the bottom. I love mine. It's just right for little jobs. If you're looking for something that would really clean, then this isn't for you. Again, it's for those 20 or so pebbles that end up at the bottom of your hot tub from people simply getting in barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use! No batteries!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has been perfect for us! It seems almost too simple in how it operates. By covering up a small hole with your finger, suction is created at the end of the vacuum. We have been completely satisfied with this product and would highly recommend it to anyone with a hot tub. We purchased a battery operated one last year and couldn't get it to work at all! This vacuum provides suction for only a short period of time, but it is very easy to drain and reuse. It takes only a few minutes to do a great job. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tornquist

customer_reviews.title: Hmmmmm🤔🥺
customer_reviews.text: The set-up/assembly was easy but the instructions were unclear about certain elements of the assembly. The suction works, but would have been better if you could get "more suction" out of it. Downside to this product was the price. For what it is...not really worth the money for the job it does...Sorry! Design may need to be rethought out for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gallier

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job, could do it better
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. We use it on out hot tub. Suction only lasts about 3-4 seconds. Make sure you position the cleaner at the exact spot you need to clean or you'll find yourself doing multiple rounds. The fully collapsed telescopic pole doesn't need to be as long as it is. As a result, if you have short arms you might struggle getting your finger over the suction hole.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Hovnanian

customer_reviews.title: It would take forever to clean anything
customer_reviews.text: Mine maintains suction for about 2 seconds, then you have to pull it out of the water, wait for all the water to drain (15 seconds), and put it back in for another 2 seconds of suction. Extremely slow and inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: John Roads

customer_reviews.title: For spot cleaning only
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and concept but it really is only for spot cleaning. The suction last about 2 seconds. I have an 8 foot spa and it would take hours to clean with this for a total spa cleaning. I bought it with hopes of doing a little more than what it does. I only use for a quick clean up of sand. Also you can only grab what's on the bottom and nothing on the surface. You'd need a skimmer to get stuff off the top. I have a bigger, better powered vacuum for the real deal. Your money is better invested in a true spa vac unless you're going to spot clean every day.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: For something with no actual power it does a decent job. The way the kids are in and out of the hot tub it will never be truly free of grass and grit but this helps remove most of it and it is simple to operate. this is my second one. The first essentially disintegrated from being out in the sun for many years. I understand that and bought a new one to replace it. The new one doesn't seem any different so I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bishop

customer_reviews.title: or other fine particles. Also isn't a continuous siphon
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was hoping for. Does a decent job of removing larger debris, but doesn't filter sand, dirt, or other fine particles. Also isn't a continuous siphon. Basically works like putting your finger over the end of a drinking straw to trap some liquid, except in reverse. You have to pause, empty the water from the chamber, and repeat the process every 5-10 seconds. Not very efficient for larger spas. I would have been happier with a fish tank syphon.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Update: I contacted the company and they are sending a replacement part. Very friendly people! I gave this 3 stars because it came with a broken part. The nozzle is cracked along the side and will not work. Seems to work ok without it but having that nozzle would make it so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of junk. I got it for my small inflatable hot tub, so not a big area to clean. In the collection cup there is a small circular felt filter and a small circular mesh filter that sits over that. They don’t stay laying flat, get wrinkled up and float to the top of the cup causing anything you may have picked up to flow back out with the water. Plus the small amount of suction time is not long enough. It has to be upright because if you tip it at all the suction stops working. I would not recommend this item to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: works fine, but would like to keep it more than one season
customer_reviews.text: works very well but I want to replace the filters. no directions at all on how to remove check valve to replace filters reluctant to force check valve off of vac concerned with breakage yet that seems the only way to replace filter. Having some instruction would bo along way to making this not a deposable item. they have a parts list just no information on how to fix.
customer_reviews.author: exairline

customer_reviews.title: It was good for a little while.  Now its broken
customer_reviews.text: I went to use this the other day and the clear tube burst open when I tapped it with my hand. Literally with my fingers. This because the check valve door would not descend to block the garbage from coming right back out. It took me by total surprise. Now it is a useless pile of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Hot Tub Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed. I use in my hot tub to collect debris that can not be reached by a net. Works on sand and larger pieces of twigs that sink to the bottom. While the suction is very good, the capacity limited requiring several pump cycles. Does give you a nice workout. Would suggest this item for people with hot tubs.
customer_reviews.author: Trey  Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Beware!! Do NOT use in a above ground VINYL pool!!
customer_reviews.text: Product came in terrible condition. Box all beat up. Definitely not new. And not worth the almost $60. As for the product itself, it works in suction but expect to spend at least an hour or so cleaning. Once you get the hang of it, I would have to take the dirty water out because the dirt/sand would still come out. You have to clear out the filter every 5 mins or so. A day after I tried it out, we noticed accumulated water all around my pool. This thing jacked up my pool. Beware!! Now I have to patch my pool up. Hoping it works. Returned and refunded!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item and it could not be more perfect. It is lightweight and easy to use in our hot tub. You place you finger over the top hole, put it in the water and it sucks up small particles of dirt. When you lift it out of the water, clean filtered water drains back into the hot tub and the dirt gets trapped inside a removable screen that you can later hose or rinse off. This is so worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: T-Dub

customer_reviews.title: Scratched the surfaces of my tub!
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a basic vacuum to get rid of some sediment at the bottom of my spa. When I would use this suction device (not really a vacuum), it wasn't getting close enough to suction the debris so I had to hold it really close to attemt to get the debris out. It did not work at all as anticipated. The worst part was that a few days later, when I was using my spa, I discovered scratches all over the surfaces that had been "vacuumed." Now the scratches create an inviting surface for any debris to cling to! :( Not only a waste of money, but destructive to my brand new spa!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Read The review first
customer_reviews.text: Ok I seen the video and was sooo excited to get this for our blow up hot tub. Look i mean it’s not the best but it does work if you have the time and patience. it takes about 45 mins to use and i just don’t want to be doing that. Again it does work. it’s a lil expensive for manual use.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Broke after nearly 4 years - I guess that's better than average???
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item almost 4 years ago, it works well to pick up grit/leaves/dirt from small areas of the hot tub. Recently the plastic lid to the inlet valve broke, though, so now half the stuff we suck in dumps back out into the hot tub. I think I found the part on another website, for $3.08. But it would cost nearly $14 in shipping to send it to me. Thanks, but no thanks. I'll reach out to the manufacturer to see if they have a remedy. I kinda hate to buy another whole vacuum for a tiny little plastic part. If anybody has an idea how to jury rig it, please let me know. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: momof3boys

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hot tubs.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but had to write one for this product. It's simple and brilliant. It's basically a giant straw but it is perfect for cleaning the bottom of my hot tub. I wouldn't want to use it to clean a pool (probably too small) but for a spa it is the perfect size. It sucks up sand, leaves, bugs and anything else that accumulates at the bottom. Once it vaccums everything up, the filter holds everything and the clean water goes right back into the hot tub. Just rinse out the filter and put it away until you need it again. HIghly recommend this product for hot tub owners.
customer_reviews.author: James J.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use for a hot tub
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cool - SCIENCE! My 10 year son actually volunteers to vacuum out the tub because “it’s fun”. Got it for our new hot tub and didn’t know what to expect. Works great. I did find it at a local supplier for $10 less than what I bought it for on Amazon but that happens sometimes. Can’t go wrong with the product for small areas
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Use for kiddie pool?
customer_reviews.text: We tried to use it for kiddie pool since we got tired of dump water constantly when there was grass or sediments so we thought this would be a perfect solution. It does work but the part where the water gets sucked in needs to be submerged underwater for it to fully work. Would I recommend this for kiddie pool? No, but a hot tub or pool over 2ft I would.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the older version
customer_reviews.text: This is my second spa vac. The first one I had worked wonderfully and lasted quite some time - until the plastic busted from winter storage. This one unfortunately has a defect. After suctioning up debris the filter allows a good 25% of the debris to fall back in the spa. I’ve worked with it, made sure the end fitting was tight, etc. & nothing helps. Defective.
customer_reviews.author: Judy F

customer_reviews.title: NOT Powered despite the name in listing
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in a previously opened box that was taped back up. The product itself was obviously used and was dirty and someone touched up the paint on various plastic parts. In addition to this, this is not a powered vacuum. The suction comes from the user holding their finger over a hole on the pole which creates the suction. The suction lasts for about 3 seconds and then you have to take out of water and do this again. It is not strong enough to pick up small debris. This is total garbage, have no idea how it has the reviews that it has.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Rado

customer_reviews.title: The product would not assemble as shipped
customer_reviews.text: The telescoping pole should fit into the nut, but ours somehow did not, since the diameter on both pieces were exactly the same. There was a plastic sleeve inside that was out of spec. Good thing we had the old broken SpaVac, which we wanted to replace since the plastic cylinder had cracked, and used the plastic sleeve from that one on the new product. It worked, but would NOT have if we didn't have the old one to mine for parts.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne anderson

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet effective
customer_reviews.text: This is so simple but that is what makes it great. Just put in the water while covering the hole with your finger. Then simply release your finger, and there you go. Water along with silt is sucked into the tank. The tank is small, so you have to do this process again and again but no big deal. We like it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is such a low tech product that works fantastic. We have a problem with sand in our hot tub and cleaning that out has always been difficult. This tool just works. Easy to use, easy to clean. If I was forced to find something wrong, it would be the packaging. Long box. If the vacuum was not fully assembled, I am guessing the length of the box could be half the size. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Davis

customer_reviews.title: Novel concept, but it didn’t work well for me.
customer_reviews.text: Great suction—for a very brief interval while the suction lasts. A novel concept, but the tool was difficult to use in the deep part of my spa and was useless cleaning the top steps of the pool where the water is shallow. I will replace this tool with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Beezer

customer_reviews.title: Works really well on a jacuzzi.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product and upon receiving it, the box was a little disfigured but thought that may have happened during shipping. Opened it and the product appeared to be unharmed. There was no assembly, all i had to do was take out the instructionals from inside the canister and it was ready for use. I have a D-1 Jacuzzi that seats 7 people and needed something that could get the small leaves from the bottom. This works perfectly. It is also great in getting out the small debris from under the filter when you take it out. I would recommend this to anyone that has a small pool or Jacuzzi. I love it..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got one good use out of it.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well, once. The screens and filter at the bottom of the debris canister did not stay in place allowing debris to flow back into our spa. The vacuum action gives you a nano second of suction. Pass on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and operate.
customer_reviews.text: Like the easy simple good results for my swim spa.My last one survived for ten years.The replacement price in my opinion has gone up considerably.Wonder if replacement parts are available?The Poles are aluminum,it’s the plastic that gets brittle with age.
customer_reviews.author: William T

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum works as easily shown in videos. The instructions are terrible as you need the pictures on the box for a hint to clean the filters. Update: Vacuum appears to pickup fine dirt. But after a tight covering and several hours the silt is back.
customer_reviews.author: ProBait

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it takes forever to clean anything as it fills up with water very quickly. It works with suction and once the main section is filled up with water you have to take it out, let it drain and then start over. For what it is, I would think it would be a bit less $.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE, WORKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: I was going to say that it seems expensive, given what it is, but I see that Amazon.com has hiked the price by $9 since I bought it six days ago - that's nearly 20%. The device itself works well, exactly as advertised. I don't know whether a larger chamber would be impractical, but my one gripe is how often it has to be 'reloaded' with air by empting the water. I have nothing to compare it with, but at $54 now, I would look around.
customer_reviews.author: 3party

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 to 4 person hot tub!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to. Needs no power, cleans great. Perfect for my 2 person hot tub. Would use this for up to 6 person tub but not anything bigger, or for a pool. Not really designed for anything shallower than 36" deep, or with allot of square footage. (Unless you really want to work harder than necessary.)
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I really have enjoyed using this spa vacuum. I did get one that was defective but the others have been terrific!!! It sucks all the debris off the bottom of the swim spa easily. I keep a very clean spa with it and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 10ft Intex pool and was pleasantly surprised at how well such a simple mechanism works! It does a great job sucking up dirt, bugs, rocks, leaves and even sediment. Easy to use and easy to clean. Perfect for our little pool since we can't hook a vacuum up to the tiny filter.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: Worst buy...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could return it. Bought it for my new pool but I didn't actually start to use it after 30 days so I wasn't able to return it now. You only have about 5 seconds of suction power on every try....It will probably take about 100 tries to clean a small spa.
customer_reviews.author: TOKUSHI

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory to have for a spa
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool for our spa. We have a 250 gallon spa. Dirt and debris collects in a little corner on the bottom. This vac picks it all right up. Doesn't require any other equipment to use. Easy to clean out debris. Very handy tool and seems sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri  M

customer_reviews.title: Expensive gimmick
customer_reviews.text: It does sort of work. But it dumps trash back in the spa. I have to put it in and fully remove it to let the water drain out. Otherwise, a lot of garbage ends up in the water. Would not recommend this item. It's also a bit of a pain to clean the "filter" if it can be called that it's so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazons Customers

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for my pool
customer_reviews.text: This may be a great spa vacuum but it does not work for trying to remove moss off of the bottom of a 4 ft . deep above ground pool. This thing may pick up solid objects great but it is useless against moss. Not trying to bash the product. I just thought other users should know this before buying.
customer_reviews.author: J.Studdard

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Small Jobs
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly as advertised. Like most other comments, it does only work for small jobs though. I have a 4 person hot tub and it works great for us. If you had a large hot tub or pool I wouldn't recommend it though.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Wow easy to use...simple design
customer_reviews.text: I read many of the reviews before I've decided to purchase the product they are all correct it does what it says it is very easy to use and it is very useful I have a 7 person spa and sometimes you get debris in and it sucks it right up until this right out I used it a few times already and extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Kittens07

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: For picking up small debri in spa it works fine. I would like to see a larger chamber to collect more volume. Also noticed small debri will get past the screen and filter so I dump the water out of my spa. To be at least a bit green I try to use it on our plants.
customer_reviews.author: JLP

customer_reviews.title: Non-motorized vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't what I expected. I didn't read the fine print. After looking through several options I thought this might work for me. The vacuum is created by pinching the end of the pole with your thumb, not by an electric motor.
customer_reviews.author: STEVED72

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not what I hoped for. The suction lasts a split second, so it doesn't pick up more than one leaf at a time. I'll go back to vacuuming the spa with the pool vacuum hose even though it's a pain in the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I was sick. I loved this vacuum, but only got to use it 3 times before the flipper cap broke off rendering it unless. I contacted the sellers and they are sending a replacement. I really appreciate that! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: I was shocked at the ease of this product. Its perfect for hot tub cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: The package was a little beat up in shipping, and it may have been used, so I was quite skeptical at first use. I followed the instructions, which is literally put your finger on the hole, put the vacuum in the tub and release finger. It immediately sucked up the sand and grit I needed to get out of my tub. I love the design of this and that there is no pumping needed. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Player769

customer_reviews.title: Poor suction - waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I don't really care for this thing. You can only suck a small amount of debris at a time, and it really doesn't have very good suction. I could use a kitchen sieve pretty much just as well for our spa. I think it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: MamaCass

customer_reviews.title: Effective small pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This product is as described. It works well for a small above ground pool or spa. It fills quickly with water but manages to remove all the debris effectively. Very easy to use. Good value for the price. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfdog

product_meta.title: Aura 6250 Paradise Power Spa Vacuum
product_meta.description: The easiest way to remove dirt and debris from your spa. Works without batteries, hoses or other complicated hookups. Utilizes a simple siphon action.
feature_bullets: No pumping, batteries or water hook-up
Aluminum telescopic pole extends to over 7 feet
Picks up rocks, pennies, marbles, beach sand, etc

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,978 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
